titleStmt.title: The martial-field of Europe being a geographical and historical description of those parts of Europe, which are most famous in this present war, viz. I. Flanders, II. The Rhine, III. Savoy, IV. Catalonia, V. Hungary, VI. Greece. With an account of the several revolutions of those places, either by conquest or treaties of peace, particularly from the treaty of Munster in 1648. to this present time. By A. Boyer, Gent.
titleStmt.author: Boyer, Abel, 1667-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Tho. Salusbury, at the King's-Arms near St. Dunstan's Church in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: With three final index and advertisement leaves.
Copy filmed at UMI microfilm Early English Books 1641-1700 reel 2420 lacks all preliminary leaves except title page and contents leaf.
Reproduction of original in the FoOlger Shakespeare Library.

place.placeName: the King's-Arms near St. Dunstan's Church in Fleetstreet
